intro: Steffensia mollis, commonly known as the softstemmed steffensia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Steffensia mollis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after plant in horticultural collections.
